stops

Class Stop

  • java.lang.Object
    • stops.Stop
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    utilities.Writeable

    public class Stop
extends java.lang.Object
implements utilities.Writeable
    Represents a stop in the transportation network.

    Stops are where public transport vehicles collect and drop off passengers, and are located along one or more routes.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Stop

        public Stop(java.lang.String name,
            int x,
            int y)
        Creates a new Stop object with the given name and coordinates.

        A stop should be created with no passengers, routes, or vehicles. Its routing table should initially be empty.

        If the given name contains any newline characters ('\n') or carriage returns ('\r'), they should be removed from the string before it is stored.

        Parameters:
        name - The name of the stop being created.
        x - The x coordinate of the stop being created.
        y - The y coordinate of the stop being created.
        Throws:
        exceptions.NoNameException - If the given name is null or empty.

    • Method Detail

      • addNeighbouringStop

        public void addNeighbouringStop(Stop neighbour)
        Records the given stop as being a neighbour of this stop.

        This neighbour should also be recorded as a neighbour (RoutingTable.addNeighbour(Stop)) in the routing table for use when routing passengers.

        If the given stop is null, or if this stop is already recorded as a neighbour, it should not be added as a neighbour, and the method should return early.

        Parameters:
        neighbour - The stop to add as a neighbour.

      • addPassenger

        public void addPassenger(passengers.Passenger passenger)
        Places a passenger at this stop.

        If the given passenger is null, it should not be added to the stop. If the passenger's destination is null, it should be added to the stop, but the stop does not need to determine where to route it.

        When a passenger arrives at a stop, the stop should use its routing table to determine which neighbouring stop to route the passenger to based on the passenger's desired final destination see (RoutingTable.nextStop(Stop)). The stop should keep a record of where each passenger waiting at it should be routed to next.

        Parameters:
        passenger - The passenger to add to the stop.

      • getRoutingTable

        public RoutingTable getRoutingTable()
        Returns the routing table for this stop.
        Returns:
        The routing table for the stop.

      • transportDepart

        public void transportDepart(PublicTransport transport,
                            Stop nextStop)
        Records a public transport vehicle departing this stop and travelling to a new stop.

        If the given vehicle is not at this stop, or if the vehicle is null, or if the next stop is null, do nothing.

        Otherwise, this method should update the vehicle's location to be the next stop (using PublicTransport.travelTo(Stop)).

        This method should also check to see if any of the passengers currently at this stop need to be routed to the next stop, and add them to the transport vehicle to be taken to the next stop.

        Passengers should be added to the vehicle in the order in which they arrived at the stop. If the transport vehicle reaches its capacity whilst there are still passengers waiting, the remaining passengers should just be left at the stop to wait for the next vehicle.

        Parameters:
        transport - The transport currently leaving this stop.
        nextStop - The next stop the transport it travelling towards.
